page.title: 01Exford and District
page.content: Population of Exford 334. Situated on the River Exe,in the heart of the National Park. Busy hunting,fishing and walking centre with several hotels,guest houses and a youth hostel. Headquarters of the Devon and Somerset Staghounds. Ford now only a memory replaced in 1908 by a fine stone bridge which was the scene of one of Tom Faggus' exploits described in Lorna Doone. Hill top church contains a fine screen. Village surrounded by hill farms and higher up grass moor and heather moor. Employment_Farming,Tourism,The Hunt, National Park,Shops,Post Office and School.
